current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Comptroller General of the United States to submit to Congress a report on the
			 entrepreneurial impact of technology transfer at the National
			 Laboratories.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

header.#text: Report on entrepreneurial impact of technology transfer

Comptroller General of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report on the entrepreneurial impact of technology transfer
			 at the National Laboratories (as the term is defined in

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 2 of the
			 Energy Policy Act of 2005

text.#text:
The report under subsection (a) shall be based on an evaluation of quantitative performance
			 metrics, including—
the number of licenses granted to small businesses;
the number of start-up businesses created;
the period of time required for execution of a license; and

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2883 IS: To require the Comptroller General of the United States to submit to Congress a report on the entrepreneurial impact of technology transfer at the National Laboratories.
